children.text: The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error.

options: We will definitely win the match

children.text: Select the most appropriate meaning of the idiomatic expression: 'Caught red-handed'

options: Caught stealing red objects like apples and tomatoes
Caught in the act of doing something illegal
Caught with a hand covered in blood
Caught by someone wearing a red wristband

children.text: Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment: 'I cannot understand that you are trying to say.'
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word: Random
Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
Select the most appropriate meaning of the idiom: 'To be all ears'

options: To be ready and eager to listen

children.text: Have you checked if we have ______ information about the location?
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech: “Where did the children leave their record books?” the sports coach asked the class prefect.

options: The sports coach asked the class prefect where the children are leaving their record books.
The sports coach asked the class prefect where have the children left their record books.
The sports coach asked the class prefect where the children had left their record books.
The sports coach asked the class prefect where the children leave their record books.

children.text: Rearrange the sentences to form a meaningful paragraph: A. Understanding a printed text comes from the interaction between printed words and one’s prior knowledge of the world. B. Comprehension is the ability or process of understanding something that is spoken or written. C. Listening comprehension, however, involves multiple processes in understanding and making sense of spoken language. D. In active reading, readers think about their reading, and make connections and inferences.
One-word substitution: Doing something awkwardly or in a clumsy manner
One-word substitution: Someone who studies elections and voting statistics
Select the passive form: The central team visited eight villages in the state to assess the damage to the crops.

options: Eight villages had visited the central team to assess the damage to the crops.
Eight villages in the state were visited by the central team to assess the damage to the crops.
The central team assessed the damage to the crops in eight villages in the state.
The damage to the crops was assessed in eight villages in the state by the central team.

children.text: Fill in the blank: This training programme for students will help the ______ understand the different methods of communication.
Substitution: Seldom do we find so many birds nesting during this season.
Select the synonym of the word: Bolster
Find the error: The project is / tough and I / can't be able to / complete it by Monday.
Antonym of: Fritter
Antonym of: Bias
Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.

Rearrange the sentences to form a paragraph: A. The main activity of Palampur is farming and 80 families of the upper caste own the majority of land in Palampur. B. Palampur village has around 450 families. C. The neighboring towns of the village are well connected. D. There are other activities in Palampur like dairy, etc.
Fill in the blank: Millions of people left the ______ and went to work in big factories.
Fill in the blank: They want a cleaner, ______ environment.
Fill in the blank: ______, there are more jobs in service industries like banking, tourism and food delivery.
Fill in the blank: Modern transport has made it easier for people to ______ to work.
Fill in the blank: Cities are growing fast, but ______, away from city centres.
